API¶

DoD module¶

LCL-Robots is a project for the automatic generation of task-specific robots using user specified modules. The current library, design-on-demand (DoD) provides the enables the automatic design process of robots provided the modules and the required task.

class DoD.robotDoD(name)¶

Bases: object

Returns the object for a higher-level class with basic set of tools to setup the modules. The higher-level class which consists of robotModule class and contains functions to manipulate modules. Further houses the necessary functions to manipulate the constructed robots.

Parameters

name – Required name for the robot that is to be created

add_eef()¶

Adds an end_effector to the end of the kinematic tree

add_module(module)¶

Adds a given module to the kinematic tree. This addition not only adds the corresponding link in the URDF, but also adds the corresponding joint based on the module type. So a joint module also adds a joint tag and a transmission tag along with the link in the URDF.

Parameters

module – The module object

add_root(default=True)¶

Add a root frame, or a world frame to initiate the kinematic tree

computeConnection(module)¶

Computes spatial tranformations with the previous module in the kinematic tree.

Parameters

module – The module to be added

constructURDF(path=None)¶

Saves a the URDF file to disk

Parameters

path – None by default, but path for the URDF file to be saved can be given

class helperFuncs¶

Bases: object

Class containing all the helper functions, i.e., primitive mathematical functions required to manipulate the modules.

list2space(com)¶

Converts a given list into space seperated string required by a URDF file

Parameters

com – An array or list that needs to be converted

resolve_axis(module)¶

Resolves the axis and the angle given a singularity, i.e., if there is a gimbal lock

Parameters

module – The module object

rotX(angle)¶

Returns a rotation matrix for a rotation about the X-axis by a given angle

Parameters

angle – Angle of rotation in radians

rotY(angle)¶

Returns a rotation matrix for a rotation about the Y-axis by a given angle

Parameters

angle – Angle of rotation in radians

rotZ(angle)¶

Returns a rotation matrix for a rotation about the Z-axis by a given angle

Parameters

angle – Angle of rotation in radians

transform_vector(axis, angle, vector)¶

Transforms a given vector about a given axis and angle

Parameters

  • axis – Axis of rotation

  • angle – Angle of rotation in radians

  • vector – The vector which needs to be transformed

initiate_modules()¶

Initiates default modules as per the LCL-Robots projects. These modules can be inspected using the meshes folder

class robotModule(name)¶

Bases: object

Returns the object with basic set of tools to describe the modules. The base class for describing the compatibility rules and module classes. Further houses the necessary functions to assemble various modules together.

Parameters

name – Required name for the module that is to be created

visualiseModule(module, meshcat)¶

Visualise input module

Parameters

  • module – The module instance

  • meshcat – The initialised meshcat instance

visualiseRobot(urdf_path, meshcat, frames=False)¶

Given a URDF file, publishes the diagram to a given meshcat server

Parameters

  • urdf_path – The URDF file path

  • meshcat – The initialised meshcat instance

  • frames – Optionally add frame information to the published plant (robot)

Node module¶

LCL-Robots is a project for the automatic generation of task-specific robots using user specified modules. The current library, design-on-demand (DoD) provides the enables the automatic design process of robots provided the modules and the required task.

class Node.Node(roboDoD)¶

Bases: object

This class is at the intermediate level where it takes in the robot module class and uses the compatibility rules from the previous class to constructs meaningful robots, this also does all the housekeeping of creating multiple instances of the robot environment i.e., creating branches and populating the correct branch

Parameters

roboDoD – An instance of the class robotDoD

computeOptimalDesign(visualise_search=False)¶

TBD Returns the optimal design (composition of modules) using the prescribed search algorithm, with respect to the cost function defined

Parameters

visualise_search – Visualise the search procedure in the meshcat server

compute_heuristic_cost(urdf_path, model_name)¶

Returns the heuristic cost of the selected module. This function needs to be modified according to the task definition and hence should be overridden for a required problem.

Parameters

  • urdf_path – The path of the saved node

  • model_name – The name of the node

compute_path_cost(node)¶

Returns the path cost of the selected node, i.e., the cost associated with the selected modules

Parameters

node – The selected node

create_instances(num_instances=None)¶

Returns instances of the a set of same class objects that can be used to expand the robot architecture with different modules in each one of them

Parameters

num_instances – None, number of instances to be created

expand_node()¶

Returns number of instances of the parent node equal to the number of compatible modules

get_best_child_index()¶

Returns the index of the best child node based on the cost function defined

get_compatible_modules()¶

Returns a list of compatible modules for the last module in the kinematic tree
